column4: im having a problem with libcss or libdvdread and i dont know how to debug it
i try and get vlc, or dvdbackup, to play the dvd, and it hangs forever while pulling the css key, and then says error cracking css key
and then the drive light goes off
where do i start with trying to figure out what the problem is
it will crack other dvds but not these two. it takes forever to find the keys tho
a good way to debug your problem is to call vlc/dvdbackup from a terminal, and look closely at the output on your terminal. most programs would output their messages/errors on stdout
i did. thats how i know the output from libdvdread
id like to get more verbosity though
and i still dont know whether it's the dvdread or the css library thats the problem
but it passes stuff off to libdvdread and libcss
i get the same output from those no matter what switches i use
wow thats a lot of buffer
there's an environment variable that you can set to increase the verbosity of libdvdcss output
how do i set the environment variable
